Sentencas: An irreversible hybrid solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC)-Brayton heat engine system is taken into account in this study.
Titulo: Performance analysis of irreversible solid oxide fuel cell - Brayton heat engine with ecological based thermo-environmental criterion

Sentencas: Ecological based thermoenvironmental function is considered to assess the performance of the system as well as the power, exergy destruction, energy and exergy efficiencies.
Titulo: Performance analysis of irreversible solid oxide fuel cell - Brayton heat engine with ecological based thermo-environmental criterion

Sentencas: This function enables someone to determine environmental impact of any thermal cycle.
Titulo: Performance analysis of irreversible solid oxide fuel cell - Brayton heat engine with ecological based thermo-environmental criterion

Sentencas: Optimum operating conditions for all investigated parameters are obtained.
Titulo: Performance analysis of irreversible solid oxide fuel cell - Brayton heat engine with ecological based thermo-environmental criterion

Sentencas: Results are presented numerically and discussed.
Titulo: Performance analysis of irreversible solid oxide fuel cell - Brayton heat engine with ecological based thermo-environmental criterion

Sentencas: Some important results are; maximum power density of the hybrid system is 15260.9 (W m(-2)) at i = 17,000 (A m(-2)), maximum energy efficiency of the hybrid system is 0.841 at i = 7200 (A m(-2)), exergy efficiency of the hybrid system is 0.676 at i = 5200 (A m(-2)) and ecological based thermoenvironmental function density of the hybrid system reaches maximum value at i = 5800 (A m(-2)) and it is equal to 0.00603 (W m pts(-1) m(2)).
Titulo: Performance analysis of irreversible solid oxide fuel cell - Brayton heat engine with ecological based thermo-environmental criterion

Sentencas: Finally, environmental friendly and efficient operation conditions, i(f) <= i <= i(p), is suggested for the hybrid system.
Titulo: Performance analysis of irreversible solid oxide fuel cell - Brayton heat engine with ecological based thermo-environmental criterion
